aaalac.title: AAALAC International
aaalac.description: The premier accrediting organization for laboratory animal care programs worldwide. Voluntary peer-review process evaluates institutions against the Guide and other standards.

aaalac.title: AAALAC FAQs
aaalac.description: Common questions about accreditation standards, site visits, deficiencies, and maintaining accreditation status.

aaalac.title: AAALAC Position Statements
aaalac.description: Official positions on emerging issues in laboratory animal care, including social housing, environmental enrichment, and animal welfare assessment.

aalas.title: American Association for Laboratory Animal Science (AALAS)
aalas.description: Professional organization providing education, certification, and networking for laboratory animal science professionals.

aalas.title: The 50 Years of Laboratory Animal Science
aalas.description: Historical overview documenting the evolution of laboratory animal science as a profession and field of study.

aalas.title: The History of the Animal Welfare Act (AWA)
aalas.description: Development of federal animal welfare legislation from its 1966 origins through modern amendments expanding coverage and standards.

aalas.title: The History of the Public Health Service Policy on the Humane Care and Use of Laboratory Animals
aalas.description: Evolution of PHS Policy from its 1971 establishment through implementation of the Health Research Extension Act and subsequent revisions.

iacuc-guidebook.title: ARENA/OLAW Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee Guidebook (the Guidebook)
iacuc-guidebook.description: Comprehensive resource covering IACUC functions, protocol review procedures, regulatory compliance, and best practices. Essential reference for IACUC administrators.

avma.title: AVMA Guidelines for the Euthanasia of Animals: 2020 Edition
avma.description: Evidence-based guidelines on humane euthanasia methods for various species. Widely accepted standard for acceptable and conditionally acceptable techniques.

dod.title: The Care and Use of Animals in DOD Research. September 1, 2022
dod.description: Department of Defense manual implementing PHS Policy requirements plus additional DOD-specific standards for military animal research programs.

dod.title: Department of Defense Instruction: Use of Animals in DOD Programs. September 13, 2010; amended March 19, 2019
dod.description: DOD Instruction 3216.01 establishing policy, assigning responsibilities, and prescribing procedures for animal use in defense programs.

va.title: Department of Veterans Affairs. Handbook 1200.07, Use of Animals in Research. May 23, 2023
va.description: VA requirements for animal research programs in VA medical centers, incorporating PHS Policy with VA-specific provisions.

va.title: Guidance for VHA Directive 1200.07 VA Research with Animals. May 2023
va.description: Implementation guidance clarifying VA Handbook requirements and providing supplemental information for VA animal research program administrators.

ag-guide.title: Guide for the Care and Use of Agricultural Animals in Research and Teaching. Federation of Animal Science Societies, Fourth Edition, 2020
ag-guide.description: Specialized guidance for farm animal research covering species-specific housing, husbandry, veterinary care, and welfare considerations not addressed in the Guide.

guide.title: Guide for the Care and Use of Laboratory Animals (the Guide)
guide.description: The primary reference for laboratory animal care standards. Required for PHS-funded research. Covers housing, environment, veterinary care, personnel, and IACUC oversight.

nuremberg.title: Nuremberg Code
nuremberg.description: Historic 1947 ethical code establishing principles of voluntary consent and protection of research subjects. Foundational to modern research ethics across species.

olaw.title: National Institutes of Health Office of Laboratory Animal Welfare (NIH OLAW)
olaw.description: Federal office monitoring PHS-funded animal research compliance. Negotiates Assurances, investigates allegations, provides guidance, and ensures adherence to PHS Policy.

olaw.title: FAQs
olaw.description: Frequently asked questions on PHS Policy interpretation, IACUC functions, protocol requirements, and compliance issues.

olaw.title: Guidance Notices
olaw.description: Official guidance documents clarifying PHS Policy requirements and providing implementation instructions for institutions and IACUCs.

olaw.title: Articles by OLAW Staff and References
olaw.description: Scholarly articles and professional writings by OLAW staff on animal research policy, compliance, and welfare topics.

olaw.title: Commentary
olaw.description: Expert commentary providing OLAW interpretation of PHS Policy requirements and responses to common compliance scenarios.

phs-policy.title: Public Health Service Policy on Humane Care and Use of Laboratory Animals (PHS Policy)
phs-policy.description: Federal policy governing all PHS-funded animal research. Requires IACUC oversight, Guide compliance, veterinary care, and institutional accountability through the Assurance.

phs-policy.title: Health Research Extension Act of 1985
phs-policy.description: Federal law (P.L. 99-158) establishing legal requirements for animal research programs and mandating IACUC review of PHS-funded activities.

phs-policy.title: US Government Principles for the Utilization and Care of Vertebrate Animals Used in Teaching, Research, and Training
phs-policy.description: Nine foundational principles guiding ethical animal use. Incorporated into PHS Policy as the basis for institutional animal care and use programs.

usda.title: US Department of Agriculture Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (USDA APHIS)
usda.description: Federal agency enforcing the Animal Welfare Act through inspections, investigations, and regulatory oversight of research facilities.

usda.title: Animal Welfare Act and Animal Welfare Regulations (AWA and AWAR)
usda.description: Federal law and implementing regulations (9 CFR Parts 1, 2, and 3) setting minimum standards for animal care, IACUC oversight, and facility operations. Covers most warm-blooded animals except purpose-bred rats, mice, and birds.

usda.title: Licensing and Registration Under the Animal Welfare Act (AWA): Guidelines for Dealers, Exhibitors, Transporters, and Researchers
usda.description: Detailed guidance on AWA registration requirements, compliance expectations, and regulatory procedures for research facilities and other regulated entities.

usda.title: Publications and Reports
usda.description: Official publications including Annual Reports, inspection data, policy updates, and Animal Care Resource Guides addressing specific compliance topics.

training.title: AALAS Learning Library, Compliance & IACUC Training Modules
training.description: Online training modules covering animal care techniques, IACUC administration, regulatory compliance, and professional development for laboratory animal professionals.

training.title: Research Ethics Timeline, Interactive timeline that explores milestones in the ethics of research with humans and other animals
training.description: Interactive historical overview of key events shaping modern research ethics standards across species.

training.title: Collaborative Institutional Training Initiative (CITI) Program. Animal Care and Use Modules
training.description: Web-based training covering animal research regulations, IACUC functions, animal welfare, and species-specific considerations. Some modules restricted to institutional subscribers.

training.title: Occupational Health and Safety in the Care and Use of Research Animals. National Research Council, National Academy of Sciences. 1997
training.description: Guidance on protecting personnel from zoonoses, allergens, physical hazards, and chemical exposures when working with research animals.

training.title: American College of Laboratory Animal Medicine Position Statement on Adequate Veterinary Care
training.description: ACLAM guidance defining adequate veterinary care requirements including authority, availability, qualifications, and program oversight.

training.title: The IACUC Handbook (3rd Edition). CRC Press. 2014. This resource is not freely available
training.description: Comprehensive reference on IACUC operations, protocol review, regulatory compliance, and program management. Purchase required.
